string.text: Note:\nThey say thereТs an entrance in the Valley to an underground tunnel that leads straight into the Sarcophagus... Might be worth checking out.

Note:
Important:
Pick up the package from Seriy and pass it to his brother.
At the Bar, closer to midnight, he goes by Rutik. Ask the Barkeep.

Note:
Pass Kuznetsov regards from Predybailo.
Verbatim: told me to bow with respect.
HeТll let you through for free.

Note:
Once the network is back up, pass this to everyone:
Emission after 3 a.m.
Info from the Freedomers at the Barrier.
Note:\nRecipe from the Swamp Doctor:\nApply a Jellyfish (all properties reduced to zero) to your feet overnight. Clears up fungus.
Note:\nDo not sell:\nУTitanium KolobokФ Ч this oneТs for Sultan.
Incoming:\nLyoha! Turns out the Guide is a beast! Can you believe it, he wiped out a pack of dogs past the bridge! Alone!!! O_o

Outgoing:\nNah, thatТs BS! There were three of them Ч the Guide and a couple other stalkers. Still badass though. I think *that* guy was there too, you know, the fancy oneЕ WhatТs his nameЕ You know who I mean.
Incoming:\nNope.
Outgoing:\nHe stopped by our village not long ago, had a Vintorez with him, said hi by the campfire and then took off fastЕ
Incoming:\nAnd whoТs Vintorez?

Outgoing:\nMan, youТre such a rookie! ItТs a sniper rifle, insanely good. Costs a fortune though. IТll make enough and buy one someday. Hey, move to our village already Ч whyТre you rotting on that farm?
Incoming:\nNah, youТve got military patrols there. They donТt come here.
Outgoing:\nSo what about the military? Sidorovich runs things here Ч all good.
Incoming:\nNope, IТm fine where I am.
Outgoing:\nYour loss.
Outgoing:\nKolyan, you know anyone from Freedom?
Incoming:\nI do, but that stays between us. What do you need?
Outgoing:\nNeed to get in touch with Screw. Need small screwdrivers Ч Phillips and Torx. Really small, like watchmaker ones.
Incoming:\nDo you really have to go to the Warehouses for that? Nobody closer has them?
Outgoing:\nSeems like no. I asked around, annoyed everyone with those screwdrivers already. And why go myself? Stalkers go there anyway Ч someone can pass them along.
Incoming:\nYou realize how much theyТll charge you for that? Anyway, if you really need it, IТll tell my guy. HeТll message you and say heТs from me.
Outgoing:\nYeah, thanks!

Incoming:\nVityok, weТre screwed, save us! BorovТs guys boxed us in the Valley, near the factory. We wonТt fight back, thereТs too many of them Ч weТll surrender. Find two УNight StarsФ and bring them here. Be by the bulldozer near the little swamp tomorrow morning. Hand the artifacts to their courier, IТll settle up with you later.
Outgoing:\nNo need to search. ChemistТs got two Night Stars. IТll borrow them. But keep in mind Ч it goes on your tab.
Incoming:\nThatТs fine. Just keep it quiet, donТt tell our guys. We dug up something interesting Ч no need for noise. ;)
Outgoing:\nDidnТt get a thing, but I smell profit. :) IТm in. Just be careful there, donТt start flexing, or youТll get shot. And the two Night Stars will be wasted. :))
Incoming:\nThx. ThatТs it Ч donТt message me again.
Incoming:\nSanyok, hey! Heard the news? Turns out Sakharov is growing watermelons inside the bunker perimeter!
Outgoing:\nWhat nonsense? HeТs not growing any watermelons, I was there just yesterday.
Incoming:\nDid you go *behind* the bunker? Exactly. HeТs got a whole melon patch there. Write to him, make a deal, buy a watermelon Ч youТll never get anything tasty from beyond the perimeter.
Outgoing:\nI doubt itЕ I canТt message him, but if IТm there soon IТll check. And whyТd you even think he has a melon patch? OhЕ got it. Some kind of joke?
Incoming:\nNot a joke. Someone told me today, and supposedly some Marked One told them.
Outgoing:\nYeah, great sourceЕ People say heТs not all there in the head. Still, IТll check.
Incoming:\nHey, ValyukhaЕ You were collecting something for Sidorovich, right?
Outgoing:\nHey. Yeah, I was. Why? Heading there? Maybe you could deliver it? I really canТt leave right nowЕ
Incoming:\nNo need to rush. They say he died last night.
Outgoing:\nWho?! Sidorovich?! Get outta here! No wayЕ What from?
Incoming:\nNo idea. Got a message from a Cordon guy: УSidorovich died at night. Funeral Ч Monday, 10 a.m., at the Cordon.Ф
Outgoing:\nDamnЕ So what now? Who do we bring loot to?
Incoming:\nNo clue, but someone will take over for sure. Nature abhors a vacuumЕ you know the rest.

Outgoing:
YouТre full of it!.. I asked around. Look:
УTo everyone! IТm alive and well, not planning to die. The joker has been identified and punished. Ч SidorovichФ
Ha! See?
Incoming:\nYeahЕ Bastards. Nothing sacred.
Outgoing:\nSidorovich!?
Incoming:\nYeah?
Outgoing:\nWhenТs the next time youТre sending letters outside?
Incoming:\nThe day after tomorrow. Then on the 27th.
Outgoing:\nHow much?
Incoming:\nIs it just a letter? Or a package?
Outgoing:\nJust a letter. Home.
Incoming:\nSame as usual. Bring it Ч weТll work it out. The 27th will be cheaper.
Outgoing:\nIf I give it to Seriy at the Garbage today and he comes to you Ч will it go out the day after tomorrow?

Incoming:\nWhat am I, Federal Express? How should I knowЕ IТll try. DonТt seal the letter, put the money inside. And remember Ч I read letters and cross out anything unnecessary if needed. DonТt put anything else in the envelope besides money. Only the letter goes beyond the perimeter Ч everything else stays with me.
Outgoing:\nYeah, I know, I sent one recently.
Incoming:\nAlright then. Bring it today, IТll try to send it the day after tomorrow morning.
Outgoing:\nThanks!
Incoming:\nLyoha! Tomorrow weТre heading to Agroprom. The militaryТs got rockets for launchers Ч need about tenЕ no, better twenty.
Outgoing:\nYeah right, IТm already running. Why do you need rockets?
Incoming:\nDuty threw us a job. VoroninТs birthday is coming up. They want fireworks. I agreed. You in? Pays well.

Outgoing:\nThey do pay well, sure Ч but the military shoots well too. And not fireworks, but heavy calibers from APCs. IТve got doubtsЕ Feels like you just want to stock up under this excuse. We need launchers there like last yearТs snow.
Incoming:\nWeТre not stealing! I messaged a guy there Ч for some vodka heТll get you anything, even a УTopol.Ф
Outgoing:\nNope, not going. And I donТt recommend it to you either. YouТll get shot Ч and worst of all, theyТll take the vodka.
Incoming:\nMan, youТre such a wuss! WhyТd you even come to the Zone then? ShouldТve stayed homeЕ
Outgoing:\nNone of your business. And donТt offer me this kind of crap again.
Incoming:\nMityai, you write poetry, right? Hi.
Outgoing:\nWell, sometimesЕ Hi.
Incoming:\nI need something about the Zone, but for a girl, you know?

Outgoing:\nWhatТs there to get? And whereТd you even find a girl, tell me Ч maybe I could tooЕ Alright, something like: УThe Zone is scary, death at every step, but I love you and think only of you, even in my deadliest hour.Ф That work?
Incoming:\nYeah, something like that. HowТd you figure it out?

Outgoing:
I actually wrote something like that just recently. Here, from my latest:
We lit a fire near the village.
Resin on the logs like tears,
With a guitar I sang a song
About your smile and your eyes.
YouТre far away right now,
Between us stand the checkpoints,
ItТs not easy for me to reach you,
As long as IТve got bolts in my pocket.
ThatТs just an excerpt. Will it do?
Incoming:\nYeah, thatТs exactly what I need! Can you give me the whole poem?
Outgoing:\nFour thousand. Or a УFlash.Ф
Incoming:\nDamn, youТre really ripping me off!
Outgoing:\nThen write it yourself!
Incoming:\nAlright, IТll think about it. IТll ping you again.
Incoming:\nSakharov is a bastard!!!
Outgoing:\nHey. WhatТs wrong? What did he do to you?

Incoming:\nMade a deal with the professor for a good job. Came to see him Ч and thereТs already some Duty guy sitting there. Sakharov goes, УSorry, friend, youТre late, itТs already been taken.Ф And both of them are smirking. Especially the Dutyer Ч smug face!
Outgoing:\nWell, what did you expect? Obvious: whoever came first got the job. Sakharov favors Duty.
Incoming:\nThatТs not how business is done. We had an agreement!
Outgoing:\nAh, forget it. Come with me to the Garbage the day after tomorrow Ч Bes needs something there. HeТs gathering a big group.
Incoming:\nTo shoot bandits or what? Is Bes even there? Heard he leftЕ
Outgoing:\nNah, probably not bandits Ч itТs quiet there now. But somethingТs neededЕ And why do you care if itТs Bes or not? WeТre broke. ThereТll be work, and people to talk to.
Incoming:\nYou and your talkingЕ Alright, letТs go. In the morning?
Outgoing:\nYeah. You at the Bar now? IТll find you there tomorrow at eight. WeТll reach the Garbage right around noon.
Incoming:\nDeal. IТll be waiting.
Incoming:\nHey! We need food supplies. HowТs that looking right now?
Outgoing:\nHey yourself! Things areЕ not great. What exactly do you need?
Incoming:\nSomething non-perishable. Mostly canned food. Dry rations. Alcohol.
Outgoing:\nHeading far?
Incoming:\nAbout three or four days. Five of us. Plus another seven at the site Ч need supplies for them too.
Outgoing:\nNope, IТm almost cleaned out. SidorТs getting a delivery tomorrow. Or rather, tonight.
Incoming:\nThatТs a long walk to him.
Outgoing:\nThen donТt walk. Order delivery.
Incoming:\nToo expensive. And no guarantee itТll get through. Heard dogs are breeding like crazy at the Garbage again?
Outgoing:\nKolyan, I canТt help you anyway. So Ч Sidor. Or you can try the Barkeep. :)
Incoming:\nVery funny.
Outgoing:\n:)) So Ч Sidor. No question.
Incoming:\nThanks, that really helped.
Outgoing:\nIgoryosha, save me!
Incoming:\nWhat now?
Outgoing:\nI need to lay low, urgently. Disappear for about two weeks.
Incoming:\nUhЕ and what do you want from me?

Outgoing:\nLong story short, you or one of your guys might get approached, asking about me. They know I ran jobs with you. Tell them I headed toward AgropromЕ Say I definitely went thereЕ Or better yet, add that someone from Agroprom said dogs tore me up, or something like thatЕ
Incoming:\nDonТt even say that! Is it really that bad?
Outgoing:\nYeah, bad :( Tell your guys too, make sure everyone says the same thing Ч went to Agroprom and hasnТt come back.
Incoming:\nAlright. And where do I find you if needed?
Outgoing:\nSorry, canТt say yet. IТll find you myself. Once things settle downЕ
Incoming:\nGot itЕ Take care.
Outgoing:\nIf everything works out, IТll repay you. WonТt forget it.
Incoming:\nDonТt sweat it. WeТll settle up later.
Incoming:\nSo, whatТd you dig up?
Outgoing:\nWhere?
Incoming:\nWhere, whereЕ in Karaganda. In that underground lab you were talking about, remember?
Outgoing:\nAre you stupid? I was just repeating rumors. We werenТt even planning toЕ You go down there and you wonТt come back.
Incoming:\nThen why talk about it at all? I heard some hotshot went down there. Supposedly hauled back so much he could buy out the whole Zone.

Outgoing:\nHa! Keep listening to fairy talesЕ SomeoneТs just inflating their price. Cheap talk. From what IТve heard, nobody can even find the entrance, and youТre telling me Уhauled backФЕ Just chatter.
Incoming:\nAnd how do you know the entrance canТt be found? That means someone looked Ч not just to check, but to go down.
Outgoing:\nThen you go find out and head in, since youТre so brave.
Incoming:\nCome onЕ Still, if you hear anything Ч youТll let me know?
Outgoing:\nYou bet!
Incoming:\nHi.
Outgoing:\nYeahЕ
Incoming:\nHeard about Cartaviy? What do you think?
Outgoing:\nWhatТs there to say Ч he lost it. Walked straight into an anomaly.
Incoming:\nYou think he did it himself?
Outgoing:\nAbsolutely. Guys were nearby, saw him tossing bolts. Thought he was trying to go around it Ч turns out he was marking it to be sure. Then he took a running leap straight in.
Incoming:\nDamnЕ Lost his mind?
Outgoing:\nHe was already pretty УoffФ before that. Screamed at night, and during the day kept ranting about some piece of the Monolith. Got all beaten down, likeЕ
Incoming:\nRemember about a month ago, another guy was going on about some Monolith fragments?
Outgoing:\nBobos? Or whatever his name was Ч Gundos?

Incoming:\nYeah, him. I saw him recently Ч unrecognizable. Almost the same thing: screaming at night, babbling nonsense about the Monolith during the day. Then they found him hanged a few days ago. Someone said he seriously pissed someone off and got strung up by thugs. But I think he did it himself. He was like a shadow lately Ч who could he have crossed that badlyЕ Lost it too. ThereТs something in common hereЕ
Outgoing:\nProbably a coincidence.
Incoming:\nSo what is that piece of the Monolith? Some kind of artifact?
Outgoing:\nOh, here we goЕ I donТt know and I donТt want to. УJellyfishФ artifacts are enough for me.
Incoming:\nStill?
Outgoing:\nItТs just nonsense. Why listen to every lunatic?
Incoming:\nStill, not for nothingЕ Alright, forget it. IТll look into it myself, let you know.
Outgoing:\nTo hell with that! DonТt you dare! I donТt even want to know Ч IТll sleep better that way.
Outgoing:\nWhen will the money be ready? IТm waiting.
Incoming:\nHey! We agreed Ч on the 30th!
Outgoing:\nI need it now.
Incoming:\nWhere am I supposed to get it right now? I only have a job the day after tomorrow.
Outgoing:\nI donТt care how, but the moneyТs needed the day after tomorrow. I helped you out, didnТt I? Now you help me.
Incoming:\nI donТt have it now! And thereТs nothing to sell, you know that!
Outgoing:\nYouТve got an assault rifle? Go to Sidor Ч he was offering good money to take out some bastard.
Incoming:\nNo, IТm not a hired gun. I wonТt go. Why donТt *you* go yourself?

Outgoing:\nIТm busy with other things right now! I owe the boys a pile of cash the day after tomorrow. IТm going on a job too Ч IТll be back the morning after tomorrow. IТll have part of the money, plus your debt. I donТt care, got it? Find it however you want, or IТll hand your debt over to the boys.
Incoming:\nHave you completely lost your mind?
Outgoing:\nThatТs it. YouТve been warned.
Incoming:\nYou at Agro? What the hell is going on at Agroprom?!
Outgoing:\nThereТs plenty of weird stuff there. Which part interests you? :)

Incoming:\nThe part where the military reinforced the checkpoint from the Garbage. Full-time guard, day and night. Nobody I ask knows why. You know anything? Maybe someone on your end heard something?
Outgoing:\nDoesnТt ring a bell. CanТt negotiate your way through?
Incoming:\nThey wonТt even let us close. Almost shot me Ч fired warning shots over my head.

Outgoing:\nYeahЕ I just asked Sidor Ч heТs playing dumb. Says heТll look into it. Really weird. Maybe theyТre running an operation? Try going there tomorrow Ч they probably wonТt keep reinforcements long. Almost certainly a one-off op.
Incoming:\nTomorrow?! One of ours, Sanya Stepnoy, fell into some well there, broke his leg, canТt get out. HeТll bleed out! Ask Sidor to at least let *me* through!
Outgoing:\nSidor says Ч not before the day after tomorrow. Turns out army brass has been crawling around there for two days already, get it? DonТt even try Ч elite спецназ is guarding the place.
Incoming:\nScum. Looks like SanyaТs going to die. What a stupid way to goЕ
Outgoing:\nWhat can I do? The Zone, brotherЕ
Incoming:\nHey. Been to the swamp in the Valley lately?
Outgoing:\nWellЕ what do you want?

Incoming:\nIn the Dark Valley near the swamps, all the grass turned yellow overnight. In the morning we were heading there for artifacts, got to the bridge and turned back. DonТt know if itТs safe. Everything around is green, but near the swamps itТs yellow Ч unnatural. Like someone painted it.
Outgoing:\nAny Flesh roaming around there?
Incoming:\nNo one. Like everything died out. ThatТs whatТs scary. But overnight a whole breeding ground of artifacts appeared there. Even capsules lying around Ч can you imagine?
Outgoing:\nMessage Semenov. He knows this kind of stuff.
Incoming:\nAlready did. No reply. And we want to go, but weТre scared, and mom says no.
Outgoing:\nTo hell with it Ч donТt go. As they say, you only live once.
Incoming:\nYeah. Still hurts thoughЕ
Incoming:\nSo, where are you? DidnТt forget our talk, did you?
Outgoing:\nWhich one? Remind me. I wasnТt quite myself yesterday, mightТve forgottenЕ
Incoming:\nWhat, were you wasted yesterday? We agreed to go on a run. ThatТs no way to do business.
Outgoing:\nYeah, maybe a bit. I remember the run Ч just remind me where and whyЕ

Incoming:\nOh, screw you! IТm not going with you. YouТve probably already had a hair-of-the-dog, and IТm supposed to drag you along? No thanks. I went all the way to the farm like an idiot, thought youТd be there alreadyЕ You screwed me over.
Outgoing:\nWhy so offended? Alright, IТll square up with you later Ч got some ammo in my stashЕ DonТt worry. I really canТt go today. WeТll sync up some other time.
Incoming:\nForget it, chatterbox. All talk, thatТs all youТre good atЕ
Outgoing:\nHeard a chopper went down?
Incoming:\nHeard. So?
Outgoing:\nThey say it was hauling food for the military. Provisions and all that. Could stock up for free. You in?
Incoming:\nAnd how do you know it was food, and for the military?
Outgoing:\nVovan dragged in a whole crate of canned meat Ч barely made it. Now heТs strutting around all proud. Soldiers are guarding the crash site. The crate got flung far away, so he grabbed it.
Incoming:\nMaybe it wasnТt from the chopper. Maybe it was just lying around.
Outgoing:\nYeah, rightЕ what just lies around in the Zone? Definitely from the helicopter. And if there was one crate, thereТs more.
Incoming:\nSure, the military will just hand it over. TheyТre dying to see you.
Outgoing:\nWeТll negotiate, trade. Worth a tryЕ Maybe thereТs some unguarded stuff lying around.
Incoming:\nNope, IТm not going. You can try explaining weТre Уon businessФЕ TheyТll shoot us as looters.
Outgoing:\nSuit yourself. DonТt come begging later.
Outgoing:\nHey bro. IТm in trouble. :(
Incoming:\nWhat now?
Outgoing:\nI was at that place, saw it. CanТt get it alone, and there are tons of snorks. Barely fought my way out. One of them bit me. :(
Incoming:\nSo burn the bite with iodine or antiseptic and bandage it.
Outgoing:\nI did. Just scared something bad might happen. I wonТt turn into a snork, will I?

Incoming:\nYou probably stabbed yourself on a branch out of fear when you saw the snork :) All that crap about ghouls, werewolves and such Ч fairy tales. What, you think youТll grow a trunk now? A dog bit me once, didnТt turn me into a dog. Forget it. YouТre alive Ч thatТs what matters. Heal up, then weТll go together.
Outgoing:\nA dogТs one thing, a snorkТs another. They say their saliva is toxic. I wonТt grow a trunk, sure, but what if I start degrading and end up like themЕ
Incoming:\nStop whining!

Outgoing:\nMaloy was telling how a bloodsucker clipped him once. Says his blood doesnТt clot right anymore. Gets worse every day. HeТs scared to even cut sausage Ч afraid heТll cut himself and wonТt be able to stop the bleeding.
Incoming:\nMaloy made that bloodsucker story up himself. If a bloodsucker really УclippedФ him, dogs wouldТve eaten Maloy long ago. HeТs always been a liar and a coward.
Outgoing:\nEasy for you to say Ч you werenТt bitten by a snorkЕ
Incoming:\nTell the guys that if you start growling, they should shoot you so you donТt bite anyone. :)
Outgoing:\nYou just joke around. My whole armТs swollen. :(
Incoming:\nDamn it! Enough! IТm logging off Ч tired of your whining.
Incoming:\nHow are things with you? What are you up to?
Outgoing:\nNothing. Sitting around, waiting.
Incoming:\nWaiting for what? The weather?
Outgoing:\nNahЕ waiting for some truck.
Incoming:\nWhat?!

Outgoing:\nWell, we made a deal with some eggheads. They tossed us a job: according to their calculations, some kind of truck should pass through here. WeТre supposed to spot it and record everything. They gave us seven daysТ worth of food for it. How they calculate this stuff Ч no idea. Just said if no truck shows up this week, then thereТs no point waiting anymore.
Incoming:\nAre you completely nuts?! TheyТre probably trying to catch the Уdeath truckФ!

Outgoing:\nSo what? Freebie. Our jobТs just to wait and take photos Ч weТre not planning on catching corpsesЕ And if it works out, thereТs pay too. Think about it: do nothing for a week, just sit in one spot. DonТt even have to scavenge for food.
Incoming:\nAnd what exactly are you going to photograph Ч dust from the wheels?

Outgoing:\nNahЕ the road runs into a blockage here. ItТll either crash, stop, or turn around. If it shows up at all. ItТs fineЕ We wonТt even eat all that food Ч weТre doing nothing and not even drinking vodka. Plenty will be left, even if we donТt film anything. And if we do, we get paid too. Either way, profit.
Incoming:\nAnd how do they know a truck will pass there?
Outgoing:\nAsk them. Maybe because theyТve seen them everywhere else, but not here yet? I donТt know. ThatТs why theyТre the eggheads Ч to calculate stuff.
Incoming:\nI wouldnТt have agreedЕ you heard what they say about those trucks?
Outgoing:\nYou didnТt want to go to the Valley either Ч always shaking, Уthis is there, that is thereФЕ ThatТs why youТre always broke. Smart people find easy jobs and donТt shake like youЕ
Incoming:\nIТm not shaking. Still wouldnТt wait for a truck.
Outgoing:\nRelax Ч all those stories are BSЕ Alright, IТll tell you later.
Incoming:\nAlright.
Incoming:\nHey, bro. HowТs it going over there?
Outgoing:\nStill screwed :(( Waiting for some kind of doctor. The guys said heТs coming.
Incoming:\nA real doctor?
Outgoing:\nNo idea. Not like IТve got a choice right now.
Incoming:\nDamnЕ At least the place youТre holed up Ч is it safe?
Outgoing:\nItТs okay. The guys left food and water Ч I can last a couple of daysЕ probablyЕ At least comms still work. They said theyТll come back.
Incoming:\nWhy didnТt they drag you out right away?
Outgoing:\nDidnТt dareЕ Said theyТre afraid IТll fall apart if they move meЕ heh.
Incoming:\nYouТre joking at a time like this? Well, thatТs somethingЕ Hang in there.
Outgoing:\nWhat else can I doЕ To be honest, IТm remembering my whole life right nowЕ
Incoming:\nAnd?
Outgoing:\nItТs all messed upЕ and nothing can be fixed anymore, damn itЕ :(
Incoming:\nHey, cut it out! Everything will be fine Ч the doctor will come and weТll get you out.
Outgoing:\nCome onЕ who are you trying to foolЕ You, uhЕ write to her, you know whoЕ
Incoming:\nEnough! Just hold on! At least these couple of days, IТm begging youЕ HeТll come for sure. IТll find him myself and drag him to you by the collar!
Outgoing:\nIТll tryЕ
Incoming:\nHey there :)
Outgoing:\nWhoТs this? What do you want?
Incoming:\nItТs Kolyan. Remember Agroprom?
Outgoing:\nAh! Hey, buddy, sorry Ч didnТt recognize you. You had a different nick, I thinkЕ Thanks again for the meds, you really helped me out.
Incoming:\nNo problem :) Hey, do you know Lyokha the Cat?
Outgoing:\nUmmЕ the one who bragged he stabbed a boar to death with a bayonet for a bet? Yeah, sat by the fire a couple times. Why?

Incoming:\nYeah, him. IТm looking for him. If you see him, tell him Kolyan Denezhka smashed his PDA against a wall while drunk, got a new one, and wellЕ rebuilding the address book. Tell him not to message me for now if heТs looking. And yeah, new nick for sure Ч decided to change it with the new PDA, people were getting annoyingЕ
Outgoing:\nIТll pass it on. And youЕ how are you yourself?
Incoming:\nCanТt reach him. Thanks. Take care.
Incoming:\nSo, did you decide? Going with us or what?
Outgoing:\nHow long is the trek exactly? And whatТs it like there overall?
Incoming:\nWhoТs going to tell you the truth, brother? Luck decides. But like Mokryak says: a week of fear Ч and your whole face is in marmalade. So, you in?
Outgoing:\nIf everyone goes, then IТm in too, obviously! When do we move?
Incoming:\nTomorrow we stock up. You gear up too Ч nobodyТs carrying your sausage and ammo for you. And be there sharp the day after tomorrow Ч donТt be late!
Outgoing:\nI will.
Outgoing:\nSeal, for GodТs sake, youТre an idiot. What the hell did you do?
Incoming:\nWhat are you on about?

Outgoing:\nYou were yapping by the campfire yesterday like a nightingale about how thereТs loot at the Farm you could haul away with dump trucks! Do you know how many people will rush there now? ItТs probably packed already. Even dogs and cats are bolting from there, eyes popping Ч never seen so many stalkers in one place! WhyТd you blab? Now thereТs nothing left but trampled grass!
Incoming:\nWatch your mouthЕ
Outgoing:\nBottom line, Seal, thatТs not how things are done. WhatТs ours stays ours Ч no need to talk.
Incoming:\nYou telling me what to do? Do I owe you something? About yesterday Ч did you clear the path with me at the Farm? Or cover my back while I was scouting?
Outgoing:\nDid you share the last thing with me? If good people asked me to look out for you, then I did. Now I see who Ч no, what Ч you really areЕ
Incoming:\nThatТs it then. I donТt know you anymore.
Incoming:\nYou know where I can get a suit fixed?
Outgoing:\nWhere else? Head to the Bar. What, didnТt you know?
Incoming:\nI know. No chance though. Those red-and-black guys declared me persona non grata. Got a message from a Dutyer today. They figured me outЕ
Outgoing:\nDamnЕ what happened? HowТd that go down?
Incoming:\nStepped into an anomaly, barely crawled out. SuitТs torn to shreds, just rags hanging. I collapsed nearby, heard bushes rustling Ч panicked and fired a double tap. DidnТt even think.
Outgoing:\nKilled anyone?

Incoming:\nDonТt know. They hit the dirt instantly and lobbed a couple grenades back. When I realized IТd fired at Duty, I bolted on all fours. The anomaly saved me Ч shrapnel got pulled upward, and I crawled like that all the way to the Garbage. Now IТm laid up. Turns out I broke my left arm too.
Outgoing:\nHoly hellЕ alright, hang on, IТll check somethingЕ

Outgoing:\nAlright, hereТs the deal. Talked to a guy named Prokhor. He said one of them got his arm pierced Ч Lyopyokha the Gray. But he saw him later, nothing serious hit Ч heТs up and already patrolling near their base. TheyТre reasonable guys overall. I explained your situation, we talked it through. So Ч once you recover a bit, come by. IТve got about three liters. From you Ч two artifacts each, so get ready. TheyТre not asking for more.
Incoming:\nBrother, thank you! I owe you big time!
Outgoing:\nItТs fine, weТll settle it :))
